TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit FontWeight extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Refers to the density of a typeface, in terms of the lightness or heaviness of the strokes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Weight differences are generally differentiated by an increased stroke or thickness that is associated with a given character in a typeface, as compared to a "normal" character from that same typeface. **Note** Not all weights are available for all typefaces. When a weight is not available for a typeface, the closest matching weight is returned. ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *fontWeightsValue* A property name, such as "Light", "Normal", or "UltraBold". ## Examples In the following code example, the FontWeight is set to "UltraBold". [!code-xml[FontSnippets#FontSnippet12](../../add/codesnippet/Xaml/FontSnippets/Window1.xaml#fontsnippet12)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static int Compare (System.Windows.FontWeight left, System.Windows.FontWeight right);
.method public static hidebysig int32 Compare(valuetype System.Windows.FontWeight left, valuetype System.Windows.FontWeight right) cil managed

Docs.param: The first <see cref="T:System.Windows.FontWeight"> object to compare.
The second <see cref="T:System.Windows.FontWeight"> object to compare.
Docs.returns: An <see cref="T:System.Int32"> value that indicates the relationship between the two instances of <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight>. When the return value is less than zero, is less than . When this value is zero, it indicates that both operands are equal. When the value is greater than zero, it indicates that is greater than .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Lighter font weights are lesser than heavier font weights. For example, a "Light" or "Normal" font weight is lesser than an "UltraBold" font weight.
## Examples In the following code example, the Compare method is used to evaluate two <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> objects.

.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Windows.FontWeight FromOpenTypeWeight(int32 weightValue) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public override int GetHashCode ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the hash code for this object.
Docs.returns: A 32-bit hash code, which is a signed integer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned value serves as a hash function for a particular type, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

MemberSignature.Value: string IFormattable.ToString (string format, IFormatProvider provider);
.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance string System.IFormattable.ToString(string format, class System.IFormatProvider provider) cil managed

Docs.param:
The <see cref="T:System.String"> specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref:System.IFormattable> implementation.

The <see cref="T:System.IFormatProvider"> to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.IFormattable.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.String"> containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.

Docs.returns: An integer value between 1 and 999 that corresponds to the `usWeightClass` definition in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_opentype](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-opentype-md.md)] specification.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a text string that represents the value of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.FontWeight"> object and is based on the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture%2A> property information.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.String"> that represents the value of the <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> object, such as "Light", "Normal", or "UltraBold".
